content.description: Rap 80' down to small belay ledge. From ledge go up and right to excellent mostly hand sized crack, arriving at a spacious ledge after 30'. From the ledge go up and left into thin crack in a shallow dihedral, stemming and using face holds.    Short people like me might opt for a super fun all out dyno off the ledge to a big jug to get established in the corner.
content.protection:
Small nuts and doubles from 00 C3 to .5 C4. Singles from C4 .75 - #2 

  Large stoppers and a micro cam for the belay.
content.location: Walk along the north side until you see an oddly shaped medium sized ponderosa (to me it was reminiscent of a truffula tree) about 30-40' feet back from the rim. The route is generally below this spot. The small belay ledge is 15' right and 15' below the ledge marking the start of the Caul of the Child fingercrack/stembox.

content.description: Puzzling sequences equally as delicate as powerful. The gear is good albeit very small.
content.protection: Many small wires, lowe balls and maybe a 000.    1x .4 at the top.   Anchor: .3 and a .4
content.location: Immediately right of Caul of the Child. Micro seem in a corner. There are two twin corners, SFH is the left of the two.Â

content.description: When you want to live in the past and you pine for different time you're in the throes of Romantic Notions. This cutie delivers. Lower to a comfortable table sized ledge about midway down. Small gear for anchor. Right off the deck you'll be in it to win it. Stays consistent and keeps you engaged till the crux 20' up. Sustained for another 10' then casual but rewarding climbing to the top. Give it a go and spray about it. Everyone loves Romantic Notions.
content.location: Furthest Left route on the Can Laude Wall. Modern, secure, non-erosion causing, progressive anchor can be found under some stones near the twin agave.

content.description: Thin technical and sustained. Release control climbs a unique corner/arete feature between Up and Cwming and Southern Fried Homicide. Switch on your focus and release control!
content.protection: 1 set of dmm offsets with an extra purple #4. 1 set of medium nuts. x2 red ball nuts 1 yellow ball nut 1 000. x2 00- .2 .  singles from .3-.5  Bring large nuts and .4 for the belay.
content.location: On the Cwm Laude wall between Up and Cwming and Southern Fried Homicide.

content.description: In a land where differences are obvious this route calls us to join forces and Cwm Together. Nestled between Mabeline & Cwm What May is a great introduction to VoCan. The Crux is setting up your anchor to avoiding using the convenience of a tree. An RB hole and a .75 and/or #1 will do the trick.
content.location: Between Mabeline & Cwm What May. Finishes just Left of Cwm What May.

content.description: Shares the start of Cwm Together then Cwm on and Lean RIGHT into the slightly wide hands crack. A beautiful "2-4-1", these two routes will delight the new trad enthusiast and provide loads of fun.
content.location: Between Mabeline & Cwm What May. Use the same anchor as Cwm Together and a considerate and well placed metal fastener just above Cwm on and Lean. Finishes just Right of Cwm What May.

content.description: With gorgeous yellow lichened streaked columns, corners, and aretes, this little wall honors what the NAZ pioneers used to call Volunteer Canyon; the Cwm, pronounced "koom", and is welsh for "valley", in case you were wondering.These collection of routes are unfairly dwarfed by the height of the rest of the North Side, though they are of high quality and as tall as 50-80ft (compare to the Paradise Forks' pillow wall for perspective). Where they lack slightly in height, they make up for in quality and close proximity of one route to the next. Two long routes, Ghost Train and Sir Rants A Lot, climb from the bottom talus.
